title: Bug 4971: Strange 'copy package'
description: Bug 4971: When performing a 'copy package' operation in the 'jdt.ui' plugin, the copied package is not named correctly. To reproduce this issue, follow these steps: 1. Open the 'jdt.ui' plugin in Eclipse. 2. Select the package 'xxx' as the source. 3. Select 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' as the destination. 4. Perform the 'copy package' operation.
OB: After performing the 'copy package' operation, the destination package 'xx' contains a package named 'ui'.
EB: Instead, the destination package 'xx' should be named 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
SR: 1. Open the 'jdt.ui' plugin in Eclipse. 2. Select the package 'xxx' as the source. 3. Select 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' as the destination. 4. Perform the 'copy package' operation and verify that the destination package is named 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
